Package com.rb.nonbiz.types

Class Correlation

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
com.rb.nonbiz.types.RBNumeric<T>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.ImpreciseValue<Correlation>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.Correlation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Correlation>
public class Correlation
extends ImpreciseValue<Correlation>
A typesafe wrapper that denotes a correlation.

This also means that the valid values are between -1 and 1, inclusive.

See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • correlation

      public static Correlation correlation​(double correlationValue)
      Constructs a Correlation in a 'forgiving' fashion, by allowing values that are outside [-1, 1] by an epsilon amount of 1e-8, and forcing them to -1 or 1, respectively.

      That's because correlations are calculated using double arithmetic, and it's not safe to rely on double comparisons.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class ImpreciseValue<Correlation>
